intro: Berkheya andongensis, commonly known as the Andong yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features a hairy stem and produces small, rounded leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
